meanings.definition: A stone that forms the base of a corner of a building.
meanings.sent1: The cornerstone of the house was strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully placed the cornerstone to ensure the stability of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorns under the cornerstone.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the old castle's cornerstone held a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The cornerstone, with its ancient markings, whispered tales of the past.

meanings.definition: The basic foundation or most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: Education is the cornerstone of a successful society.
meanings.sent2: Hard work and dedication are the cornerstones of achieving your goals.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that coffee was the cornerstone of his morning routine.
meanings.sent4: Trust is the cornerstone of any strong relationship.
meanings.sent5: Kindness acts as the cornerstone of a compassionate community.
